post:
ProwHost was established in 2020. Aiming to gain an important share in the web hosting and cloud server sector since its establishment, ProwHost continues on its way with sure steps.
ProwHost, which mainly plans to offer cloud server service, provides services from important data centers around the world. ProwHost cooperates with many important cloud brands and provides automatic setup.
For this reason, orders are activated automatically and the customer can start using the service purchased as soon as possible.

ProwHost, Inc.
EIN : 32-0639950
TOS : Terms Of Services
Payment Methods : PayPal, Credit Card

Locations :

  • USA: Ohio, Virginia, Oregon
  • Canada: Montreal
  • Europe: Frankfurt, Paris, Ireland, London
  • Asia/Pacific: Tokyo, Sydney, Seoul, Mumbai, Singapore

Common Features:

  • 2x Intel Xeon E5-2686
  • 256 GB RAM
  • 4x 1TB SSD
  • Hardware RAID10
  • 1Gbps uplink

Looking Glass : https://lg.prowhost.com/

What forms of payment do you accept?
We accept Visa, Mastercard, American Express, Discover, and PayPal. For additional payment options, including wire transfer, purchase orders, and ACH, please contact us.

Can I have a refund?
You can request a refund within 7 days. The fee for the days you use is deducted, the remaining fee is refunded.

What is the connection speed?
According to the virtual server plan that you purchased, your connection speed varies between 1 Gbit/s and 500 mbit/s. The specified network speeds may vary depending on the distance between the location of your country and the server location.

When will my card be charged?
ProwHost billing cycles are monthly. Typically, on the first day of each month we invoice and automatically charge your account’s primary payment method for the previous month’s usage. In some cases, we might charge if your usage exceeds a threshold. You can also login and self pay the balance at any time.

Can I prepay for my resources?
Yes, you can make pre-payments with PayPal. Pre-payments let you pay ahead of time for future resource usage. When your account balance is due, we apply pre-payments before we charge any credit or debit cards.
